titlepage.titleproper: Guide to Chronicle of Venice to 1618. Manuscript,17--
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by KEF, 2019

did.head: Descriptive Summary

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Chronicle of political events in Venice to 1618, with a history of Venetian nobility. Probably an eighteenth-century copy of an earlier work. Text in Italian. Codex Ms 1003.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The manuscript is open for research.

altformavail.head: Digital Images
altformavail.p: Original documents, texts, and images represented by digital images linked to this finding aid are subject to U. S. copyright law. It is the user's sole responsibility to secure any necessary copyright permission to reproduce or publish documents, texts, and images from any holders of rights in the original materials.

The University of Chicago Library, in its capacity as owner of the physical property represented by the digital images linked to this finding aid, encourages the use of these materials for educational and scholarly purposes. Any reproduction or publication from these digital images requires that the following credit line be included: Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library.

Commercial publication projects require the permission of the University of Chicago Library and may be subject to a use fee. To order publication-quality reproductions, or for permission to copy or use any part of the digital images attached to this finding aid for any commercial purposes, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.

The images presented here may include materials reflecting the attitudes, language, and stereotypes of an earlier time period. These materials are presented as historical resources in support of study and research. Inclusion of such materials does not constitute an endorsement of their content by the University of Chicago.
The University of Chicago Library appreciates hearing from anyone who may have information about any of the images in this collection.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Chronicle of Venice to 1618. Manuscript, Codex Ms 1003, Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: Ms 1003, A Chronicle of Political Events in Venice to 1618 and History of Venetian Nobility, is probably an eighteenth century copy of an earlier work. It formed part of the library of Count Demetrius Minotto (1856-1920.)
Segue l'Origine Delle Famiglie Venete Nobili Aggregate di Tempo in Tempo Per (?)enemeristi, pp. 107-260.
Tavola Delle Ricco Pazioni e Ribellioni, pp. 261-262.
Ragualgio del Tradimento Machinato contro la Innocenza della Republica di Venezia da Ministri Spagnoli, pp. 263-267.
Contemporary paper binding. Text in Italian.
